summary: The Wildlife and Fisheries Habitat Management program maintains ecological conditions needed to maintain the diversity, viability, and productivity of plant and animal communities and reforestation and revegetation efforts in support of ecological restoration and post-wildfire recovery.

summary: The Rural Energy for America guaranteed loan and grant programs help farmers, ranchers and rural small businesses purchase and install renewable energy systems and make energy efficiency improvements.
References & Data Sources: 2023 USDA Explanatory Notes Page 33-46

summary: The High Energy Cost Grants program assists energy providers and other eligible entities in lowering energy costs for families and individuals in areas with extremely high per-household energy costs.
References & Data Sources: 2022 USDA Explanatory Notes Page 33-56

summary: The Rural Energy Savings Program (RESP) provides loans to rural utilities and other companies who provide energy efficiency loans to qualified consumers to implement durable cost-effective energy efficiency measures.
References & Data Sources: 2023 USDA Explanatory Notes Page 34-24
